column4: damnit... they keep changing the switch to have glxgears print its fps... maybe they fully removed it this time
thers no switch.. it prints the fps by default here.
lol... yea, now that I run it it does here too... for a while you had to say -printfps, then glxgears -iacknowledgethatthistoolisnotabenchmark
qebab: that doesn't stop you from using another boot disk
if someone has physical access to the system..  your only real security would be to encrypt the filesystems I guess.
